a.title: Return to the homepage on the district site.

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;
img.title: COVID-19 Info

p.strong: In compliance with Governor Greg Abbott’s Executive Order that was announced today at noon, the Ponder ISD facilities will remain closed due to the COVID-19 Pandemic for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. Online learning and drive through meal service will continue as it has been through May 21, 2020.
Please note that all UIL events for the 2019-2020 school year have been canceled. Practices, rehearsals, and workouts remain suspended until further notice.
Please read the Addendum to Grading Policy During COVID-19 Remote Learning for PISD.

br.a: Visit our COVID-19 website for updated information.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19 Information Site

p.strong: txConnect Parent Portal To Be Replaced

span.p: txConnect, the current parent portal used by Ponder ISD, ceased operation on Sunday, April 19, 2020. Ascender Parent Portal will replace txConnect. This new solution will allow for online registration which has been a feature often requested by our community. Once the new Ascender Parent Portal is available we will let you know.

a.title: Go to comments for txConnect Parent Portal To Be Replaced

span.p: The Ponder ISD Board of Trustees has officially postponed both the school board trustee and bond elections for May 2, 2020. The elections have been moved to November 2020.

a.title: Go to comments for May Board/Bond Election

div.div: The official calendar for the 2020-2021 school year is available online. The previously approved calendar was ammended by the Board of Trustees on March 23, 2020 to move a Comp Day from October 2 to October 26. View the school calendar.

a.title: Go to comments for 2020-2021 School Calendar Posted

span.p: The University of Interscholastic League has posted the updated districts following realignment. Below are the districts in which Ponder ISD will participate beginning in the 2020-2021 school year. To see more information, visit the UIL realignment site.

a.title: Go to comments for UIL Realignment

span.p: Registration packets for the 2019-2020 school year are now available online. The forms can be completed online and printed at home to be returned to the school office or blank forms can be printed at home to be completed manually with pen and paper. Pre-printed paper copies will be available in the school office for families as well. Please note that there are two different forms. One form is for returning students who were enrolled at Ponder ISD last school year and a separate form for those who are new students to Ponder ISD.

strong.a: Access the 2019-2020 Returning Student Registration Packet Here
Access the 2019-2020 New Student Registration Packet Here
Access the 2019-2020 New Student SPANISH Registration Packet Here

a.title: Go to comments for Registration Forms Available

div.strong: Winter is Here, Register for Ponder ISD E-Alerts!

span.div: Website visitors can subscribe to receive notifications via email. Subscribing to e-alerts would send subscribers information such as school closings, school delays, or other high priority content. The District encourages all parents and employees to register on the website and subscribe to e-alerts so they will be among the first to know important information, especially when winter weather threatens. Read the following document for instructions on how to register and subscribe to Ponder ISD e-alerts:

a.title: Go to comments for Register for Ponder ISD e-Alerts

span.div:
EZSchoolPay Available To Parents
Once again this school year parents can view purchase and credit details online for their child's cafeteria transactions via a service known as EZSchoolPay. Through this portal, parents can see the quantity and types of items students are purchasing both at breakfast and lunch as well as view their child's account balance. Additionally, parents can also choose to have a notification email sent whenever their child's account balance drops below an amount specified by the parent. Both of these services are free. As always, if a parent chooses to make deposits online, a service charge fee is incurred. For more details, view the EZSchoolPay information page.

a.title: Go to comments for EZ School Pay Available
